thread.title: Shell files criminal complaint against ex-employee over Nigeria oilfield sale

title: Shell files criminal complaint against ex-employee over Nigeria oilfield sale
text:
March 28, 2018 / 9:06 AM / a few seconds ago Shell files criminal complaint against ex-employee over Nigeria oilfield sale Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
LONDON (Reuters) - Royal Dutch Shell ( RDSa.L ) has filed a criminal complaint with Dutch authorities against a former employee over the sale of a Nigerian onshore oilfield in 2011, a Shell spokesman said on Wednesday. FILE PHOTO: Filled oil drums are seen at Royal Dutch Shell Plc's lubricants blending plant in the town of Torzhok, north-west of Tver, November 7, 2014. REUTERS/Sergei Karpukhin/File Photo 
The suspected wrongdoing came to light as part of an internal investigation by Shell but is unrelated to a court case against Shell and Eni ( ENI.MI ) in Italy over the acquisition of the oilfield OPL 245, the spokesman said. 
“Based on what we know now from an internal investigation, we suspect a crime may have been committed by our former employee ... against Shell in relation to the sale process for Oil Mining Lease (OML) 42 in Nigeria in 2011,” the spokesman said in a statement to Reuters. 
“We have filed a criminal complaint with the Dutch authorities and are considering other steps we could take.” Reporting by Ron Bousso, editing by Dale Hudson
